sourceDesc.p: Wellington City Libraries book of typed transcriptions. Spine title "Hadfield, Typescript (amended) letters 1833-1854". Corrected by Gillian Ryan 1960. (page 22)
Re-typed and encoded into TEI by Melissa Bryant, 20.11.15

body.p: I have very little time to write but I know you would like even a few hurried lines from me. I left Ventnor on Monday morn early and came here the same day. I appeared before the Committee of the Society and received my instructions; I shall on my first going to New Zealand be engaged in a school, but afterwards in work more particularly missionary, that is in preaching the Gospel to perishing sinners. I have been very busy in town getting all the things that I require. The ship I am going in is the "John", bound to Sydney. She is about 500 tons; a fine looking ship. I have got a cabin under the poop next to the stern cabin on the larbord side; it is not very large or light, but it will be very quiet and I think comfortable. The Captain who appears a nice fellow talks of sailing on Saturday. I shall be ready by that time. I feel happy at the prospect of going because I think it is to do work which ought to be done. I feel myself unfit for so important a work but I look to the Lord for strength to support me. I saw yesterday a man from New Zealand; he says it is a beautiful climate and country. I doubtless feel much pain at leaving you all but I trust we may meet again and at any rate we can write to one another, and I hope will meet by God's mercy, thro' faith in Christ Jesus, in the country of Heaven. I was sorry to hear of the danger you were in travelling but was thankful that you were preserved. I hope you will like your new station. I suppose you will get your promotion before long. I shall have no time to see any friends in town. May the Lord bless and preserve us both, and believe me your ever affectionate brother.
I am afraid it is too late to ask you to write to me here.
